p: In this study, 5 flavonoids ( 39, 53, 56, 61, and 66) and 9 flavonoid glycosides ( 25, 29, 30, 32, 33, 34, 35, 45, and 47) in the roots of D. dentiger extract were identified based on the molecular weight and fragmentation information ( Figure 4). Compounds 39, 53, 56, 61, and 66 were belonging to flavonoids, which considered as 5,7,2′-trihydroxy-6-methoxyflavone, luteolin, diosmetin, nobiletin, and apigenin, respectively. The MS 2 spectrum of 66 shown in Figure S4 was a representative example, which showed a [M–H] – ion at m/z 269.0467, in accordance with the elemental composition of C 15H 10O 5 –.
